intro: Ixora ebracteolata, commonly known as the flame of the forest, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its bright orange-red inflorescences that resemble flames. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom throughout the year. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Ixora ebracteolata is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
